title: Dads 'distraught' as mum vanishes with their three young children
text:
Get the biggest daily news stories by email Subscribe Thank you for subscribing We have more newsletters Show me See our privacy notice Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email

The fathers of three young children who have been missing with their mother for five days are "distraught" and want them home.

Emma Davies, from Priorslee, Telford, and her three children, Kenzie Birch, one, Amelie Vince, seven, and Laylah Vince, nine, have not been seen since October 19, West Mercia Police said.

The force confirmed they have been carrying out extensive inquiries to find the 30-year-old and the youngsters, and have started to become "increasingly concerned" about their welfare.

Police have now appealed for anyone who has seen the family to come forward.

(Image: PA)

(Image: PA)

Superintendent Paul Moxley said: "Emma has now been missing with her children for five days and it is really important we find them.

"The children's dads are obviously distraught and want their children home.

"We're carrying out a lot of inquiries to try and find the family and I would ask anyone who has seen them, or has information about where they may be, to please get in contact with us."

(Image: West Mercia Police)

The officer added: "Even if they're not entirely sure if it is Emma, if they let us know we can check it out, even the smallest piece of information could lead us to find her.

"I would also appeal to Emma direct to please get in contact with us, she's not in any trouble we just want to make sure she and the children are all OK."

The force said anyone with information could contact West Mercia Police on 101 quoting reference 728s 191019.
description: Emma Davies, 30, from Priorslee, Telford, has been missing for five days with children Kenzie Birch, one, Amelie Vince, seven, and Laylah Vince, nine
